turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Oh, hi... I almost didn't recognize you -- I think I need to get glasses; you're all blurry!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You're lucky then, you can't see the veins on that guy's biceps.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Actually, he's a really nice guy.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Do you want anything?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Maybe an orange juice.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Wow... finally.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It just came yesterday...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What about me? Am I not even here?

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Oh, hey Enid...  So... we finally made it!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: We're not.

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Really? Both of you?... Why not?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Just because.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What are you going to be when you grow up, Todd?

turns.speaker: TODD
turns.text: Well I'm going to major in Business Administration and, I think, minor in Communications.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: See, that's exactly the kind of thing we're trying to avoid.

turns.speaker: MELORRA
turns.text: Oh my God, you guys! I can't believe we made it!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, we graduated high school -- how totally amazing.

turns.speaker: MELORRA
turns.text: So what are you guys doing this Summer?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: MELORRA
turns.text: I'm going to be in this actor's workshop, and I'm hoping to start going on auditions soon. I'm so excited to finally have some free time. We have to get together this summer!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh yeah, that'll definitely happen...

turns.speaker: MELORRA
turns.text: Well, bye you guys... CONGRATULATIONS!

turns.speaker: MELORRA
turns.text: Oh my god, what are you guys doing here?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What are you doing here, Melorra?

turns.speaker: MELORRA
turns.text: My acting workshop is across the street from here. I'm just on my break.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well, we won't keep you.

turns.speaker: MELORRA
turns.text: I love this place... it's so - you know, "funky."

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: It's really quite something to see you all grown up like this, Enid.  I'd love to hear about what you're doing. I can't help but feel that I had some small part in how you turned out...  What are you studying? You were always such a smart little girl.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm taking a remedial high school art class for fuck-ups and retards.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: May I ask what you're doing?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Shhh!

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: I want to know what you think you're doing, staying out all night and worrying your father to death!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh yeah, like he even noticed.

turns.speaker: MAXINE
turns.text: Listen, young lady... I know you don't like me -- I don't really care whether you do or not -- but I will not allow you to treat your father the way you do.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: A what?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: A mongoose... they eat snakes... you never heard of a mongoose?  That's a classic piece of vintage taxidermy. Nobody alive today knows how to do work like that.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: How much is this?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Umm... That's not officially for sale... I might have to hang onto that for the time being.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Perhaps the "Jam-in-ator" appeals to you.  Absolutely no practice necessary.  You shread like a giant. Just press a button.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That's okay...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Do you have any other old records besides these?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Seymour does.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Who does?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Him. Seymour. He's the man with the records.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You still interested in that?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I thought it wasn't for sale.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm thinkin' maybe I could let it go...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's kind of falling apart.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't mind me, I'll just be in my room.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Where did you get those pants?

turns.speaker: JOHN ELLIS
turns.text: Didn't they tell you?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Tell me what?

turns.speaker: JOHN ELLIS
turns.text: Punk rock is over!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I know it's over, asshole, I --

turns.speaker: JOHN ELLIS
turns.text: If you really want to "fuck up the system" - you should go to business school -- that's what I'm gonna do: get a job at some big corporation and fuck things up from the inside!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That's not even --

turns.speaker: JOHN ELLIS
turns.text: Yeah yeah yeah. Do you have my money?

turns.speaker: JOHN ELLIS
turns.text: Oh, how "punk."

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That tape sucked, by the way!

turns.speaker: JOHN ELLIS
turns.text: I'm so sorry if you were offended!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Go die, asshole!

turns.speaker: JOHN ELLIS
turns.text: Get a job!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hi... what's your name?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Norman.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: ...are you waiting for a bus?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I hate to tell you this but they cancelled this bus line two years ago... There are no buses on this street.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, if it isn't Enid and Rebecca, the little Jewish girl and her Aryan friend.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You're late, asshole.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Fine, and how are you?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Did you bring that tape?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You never paid me for that tape with the Indian dance routine.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I did too!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Tsk! You Jews are so clever with money...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Fuck you, you stupid redneck hick!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Thanks for the tape - I'll have to pay you later, I'm broke.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hey, where are you going?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Later, "Dude".

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That's five hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Five hundred.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: You're crazy -- it should be like two dollars!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I was wearing that dress the day I lost my virginity.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Well why do I care about that?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Why do you even want it? It would look stupid on you.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: God, fuck you!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Do you have any old Indian records?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Indian records?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You know, like weird 1960's Indian rock n' roll music.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I don't have anything after about 1935. I may have one Hindu 78 from the twenties in my collection, but it's not really for sale. I don't really collect "foreign."

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Those are all 78s... Can you play 78s?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Sure!... Wait, maybe not 78s, but I can play regular records...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: There's some good stuff in here... do you like old music?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Sure, I guess.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Well there's a few choice LPs in here that re-issue some really great old blues stuff.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Is this one any good?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Nah, it's not so great. Here's the one I'd recommend.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: This track alone by Memphis Minnie is worth about $500 if you have the original 78. She was one of the greatest guitar players that ever lived, and a great singer and songwriter as well. I know the guy who owns the original and lent it for use on this reissue.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Wow!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: How much is it?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: A dollar seventy-five.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, it took a while before I got a chance to play it, but when I heard that song it was like --

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: So you really liked it? Yeah, there's some really rare performances. You liked that Memphis Minnie, huh?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, that's good too... the whole record was good, but that one song, "Devil Got My Woman" -- I mostly just keep playing that one over and over... Do you have any other records like that?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: The Skip James record? Yeah, that's a masterpiece. There are no other records like that! I actually have the original 78 of it in my collection. It's one of maybe five known copies.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Wow!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Do you want to see it? I can run upstairs and get it...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, sure, I guess...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Watch my stuff.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oops! I dropped it!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: NO!!!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hey, I was only kidding!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What was all that stuff about enlarged holes and tight cracks?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I... I didn't think you would have any interest in this get together... I mean if you had told me you were coming I would have warned you -- it's not like a real party or anything.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You're right about that.  So this is your record collection?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh God no. This is just junk I have for sale or trade. The record room is off-limits.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Really? Can I see it?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, well sure... you can if you want to... it's just I don't want all these guys in there at once... you know...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Wow! This is like my dream room! Are these all records!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I have about fifteen hundred 78s at this point. I've tried to pare down my collection to the essential...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, look at this poster!  I can't believe this room! You're the luckiest guy in the world! I'd kill to have stuff like this!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Please... go ahead and kill me! This stuff doesn't make you happy, believe me.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh, come on! What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: You think it's healthy to obsessively collect things? You can't connect with other people so you fill your life with stuff...  I'm just like all the rest of these pathetic collector losers.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: No you're not! You're a cool guy, Seymour.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah right... If I'm so cool, why haven't I had a girlfriend in four years? I can't even remember the last time a girl talked to me.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm talking to you... I'll bet there are tons of women who would go out with you in a minute!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh, right...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: No really... I guarantee I could get you a date in like two seconds...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Good luck...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm totally serious!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, well...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I mean it -- You leave everything to me -- I'm going to be your own personal dating service!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I appreciate the offer but you really don't --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Mark my words, by the end of this summer you'll be up to your neck in pussy!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Jesus! That's very nice of you Enid but I - I really --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What about her? Would you go out with her?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I don't know, what kind of question is that? I mean it's totally irrelevant because a girl like that would never be caught dead with me...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: But putting that aside for now, would you go out with her?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I really didn't get a good look at her.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Okay, what about this one? Are you into girls with big tits?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Jesus!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: C'mon Seymour, I'm trying to collect data here! Don't you want me to find you your perfect dream girl?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I'm just not one of those guys who has a "type"...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Every guy has a type!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I mean as long as she's not a complete imbecile and she's even remotely attractive...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: We need to narrow this down somehow... we need to find a place where you can meet women who share your interests.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Maybe I don't want to meet someone who shares my interests.  I hate my interests! Where can I go to meet the exact opposite of myself?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah yeah yeah... Just tell me your five main interests, in order of importance.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Well, let's see... I guess I'd have to put Traditional Jazz, Blues, and Ragtime music at the top of the list, then probably...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Let's just say "music" - that way you only use up one...  Wait, we have to go in here for a second...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: So is that your boyfriend?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Josh? He's nobody's boyfriend... He's just this guy that Becky and I like to torture.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Well are --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh my god! We have to go in here!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, sure... very funny....

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Please, Seymour... Becky and I have been dying to go in here but we can't get any boys to take us...  Please?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I - I'd really rather not...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: We'll just go in for one minute -- it'll be a riot!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I don't think so...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: PLEASE? We have to!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I really don't think it's a good idea.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Fine, I'll go by myself then...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Wow! Look at all these creeps!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Shh!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: OH MY GOD!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Look at this -- "Lollipop Lolitas" - isn't child pornography totally illegal?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: These are older women just dressed up to look young... I think.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh, I don't have much money with me right now.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: C'mon, Seymour, please?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Relax, Seymour, relax...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: That thing is just so shrill and piercing and loud - it's like someone jabbing me in the face!  KFTO comin' atchya on this beautiful evening...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So, why did you bring this along?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I brought it for him to autograph. He's going to be amazed to see it - it's one of two known copies... I can't believe they have him for the opening act and not the headliner. What an insult!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: This bar's going to be packed with girls for you to pick from.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I'm not holding my breath in that department.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What are we, in slow motion here?! What are ya, hypnotized? Have some more kids, why don't you?... For Christ's sake, would you move!?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Jesus, Seymour.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yes, that would certainly do...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well, offer her a seat! You want me to do it?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Wait a minute! Hang on! Jesus, I gotta think of something to talk to her about. No! No...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Just wait here.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What did you tell that girl?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I told her you were a big record executive and you were thinking of signing that band to your label.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Jesus...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Now I remember why I haven't gone anywhere in months. I'm not even in the same universe as those creatures back there. I might as well be from another planet.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: We just need to figure out a place where you can meet somebody who isn't a total idiot, that's all.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Look, I really appreciate your help, Enid, but let's face it, this is hopeless.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It's not hopeless...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, well it's simple for everybody else - give 'em a Big Mac and a pair of Nikes and they're happy! I just can't relate to 99.9% of humanity.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, well, I can't relate to humanity either, but I don't think it's totally hopeless...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: But it's not totally hopeless for you... I've had it. I don't even have the energy to try anymore.  You should make sure you do the exact opposite of everything I do so you don't end up like me...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'd rather end up like you than those people at that stupid bar...  At least you're an interesting person... at least you're not exactly like everybody else...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Hooray for me.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I'm not sure I have anything to drink... there might be some --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It doesn't matter, I'm not staying long... I just want to make sure I convince you not to give up yet.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: "Yet."

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Wow, this is so cool...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: If you don't mind my asking -- why do you care so much if I get a date or not?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno... because I can't stand the idea of a world where a guy like you can't get a date...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What the fuck, Seymour?! What is this?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What?... Oh that... I borrowed that from work about fifteen years ago... I guess it's mine now.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What, are you a klansman or something?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, right, I'm a klansman - thanks a lot!... Do you know the Cook's Chicken franchise?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: "Four-piece Cook's special deep fried with side n' slaw it's OUT RAY-GEOUS"!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, well "Cook's" is just a made up name. When they originally opened back in 1922 they were named "The Coon Chicken Inn" -- that's an early painting of their first logo.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Actually, I was a whole lot more interested in the Cook's phenomenon when I was about your age. I've kind of lost interest since I've been working for them...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You work at Cook's Chicken?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: For nineteen years...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What are you, a fry cook or something?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Nothing so glamorous... actually, I'm an assistant manager at their corporate headquarters.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Jesus, I'd go nuts if I had to work in an office all day.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Hey, I get good benefits, a good early retirement plan, nobody ever bothers me...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, but still...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I make enough money to eat and buy old records... what more do I want?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So, I don't really get it -- are you saying that things were better back then  even though there was stuff like this?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: No, in a lot of ways things are better now... I dunno... it's complicated. Everybody still hates each other, but they know how to hide it better, or something...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hey, can I borrow this?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What? Why?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I promise I'll take good care of it.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I dunno... they're very sensitive at work about all this stuff. Maybe it would be better if you --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Don't you trust me, Seymour?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You can open your eyes now.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh... uh, thanks a lot Enid... I really appreciate it...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: No, Doofus... blow it out!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Arrrghhh! Ah Jeez... Christ...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: It's just my stupid back. I'll be all right in a minute...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh... uh... It's just this elastic thing I have to wear for lumbar support...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What, like a girdle?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Maybe now you understand why I can't get a date.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, well, you're not the only one. Everybody I know has totally fucked up problems... It seems like only stupid people have good relationships...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: That's the spirit!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I mean, I'm eighteen years old and I've never even had a real, steady boyfriend for more than like two weeks!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Never...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I'm starting to think that even if I did get a girlfriend it really wouldn't change anything.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I know. It's not like it makes all your problems go away.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Then again, that's easy for me to say, since I'll never even get a date. I'm sure you have hundreds of guys who are interested in you.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Actually, I've got a total crush on this one guy right now, but it's a really fucked-up situation...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh wait, you met him... remember that guy Josh? I'm like practically obsessed with him, but I can't do anything about it because Becky would freak out.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Never mind, it's way too complicated...  Did you have problems like this when you were my age - where you're totally confused all the time?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I won't even dignify that with a response.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I wonder if you really like all these old records or if you only like the fact that nobody else likes them?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Who knows?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Aren't you going to get that?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Let the machine get it. I have no desire to talk to anyone who would be calling me...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Wow!  What was that all about?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: It's just somebody's idea of a joke...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That didn't sound like a joke to me... what, did you write a personal ad or something?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh yeah. A long time ago... she called before once... it's just somebody trying to humiliate me.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Seymour! I promise you that wasn't a joke -- you have to call her back!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: How can you be so sure?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well, uh... I'm an expert-about stuff like this -- she was totally for real!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh... hello?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Hi, it's me...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh, hi...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So, what happened?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Actually, it's kind of still happening... she's over here right now... I think everything's going pretty well...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What? You're kidding me...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, so I better go -- it's not really the best time to talk...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What, are you going to like have sex with her on your first date?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Jesus, Enid... I'll talk to you later... bye!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Boo!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: YAAA!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Where have you been? I've been looking all over for you... I've been wandering the streets day and night trying to find you...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: No, actually Joe told me you were here... so how come you never call me anymore?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I know, I'm sorry... I-I've been really busy...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, I'll bet! So, how's it going with what's-her-name? Dana?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh... pretty well, surprisingly... you know...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So, what kind of stuff do you guys do together? Is she into old records and stuff?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Sort of... she doesn't dislike any of that stuff... she's trying, anyway... actually, we're supposed to go antique shopping for her apartment this afternoon...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Sounds good...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: We really should get together sometime soon... I-I'll definitely call you this week --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What, are you trying to get rid of me?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: No... no, it's just that I should get going in a few minutes, and --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Aren't you even going to ask me how I'm doing?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I-I'm sorry... uh so... uh... how --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno... okay, I guess...  I fucked that guy Josh finally...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: ...so... is he your boyfriend now?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Maybe... I dunno... He wants to be, of course. I'm weighing several offers at the present time...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm going to this stupid art show and I want you to be my date... There's something I have to show you...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I... I don't know. I don't really think I should...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Of course you should. C'mon, I'm already a million hours late.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: ...I better not...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well forget the art show... let's do something else.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I... I wish I could, Enid, but I really can't right now... I -- it's just that I --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Well when can we do something?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: It's just that, well, you know, Dana just got out of a really bad relationship and I don't want to give her the wrong idea... you know...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Oh, uh... they were a present from Dana.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: And you like them?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Well, you know... what do I know about clothes... I've never been the most fashionable guy -- it's nice to have someone do all the work for me...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So that's it? You don't ever want to see me again?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: No, of course I do... It's just that right now I need to --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What's her problem anyway?  Did she actually tell you you couldn't see me?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: No, no... not exactly... she just doesn't understand how I would know somebody like you...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What does she mean by that - "somebody like me"?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Just someone so young...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You must have done something to make her think you like me.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I... I don't think so.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Does that mean you don't like me?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: No, of course not.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: So, do you like me, Seymour?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: In what way do you mean?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: In whatever way you think I mean.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I don't know... I'm sorry, but Dana's a very jealous person. I just don't want to screw that up right now... I'm sure she'll dump me soon and we can go back to being friends...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I don't think you understand how I really feel about you, Seymour.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: ...What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Nothing. Don't worry, I won't bother you any more.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I had to see you.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Can you at least let me in?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh... sure... come in.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Look, I just need somebody to be nice to me for five minutes and then I'll leave you alone.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Do you have anything to drink?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh... I think there's some root beer...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What about this?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: That's Dana's - I'm supposed to be saving it for our two-month anniversary. You better not --

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: FUCK DANA. I'm sick of Dana.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You need a bigger place - this is like a little kid's room.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I could never move - I've got too much stuff.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Where did you get this?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Dana bought it when we went antique shopping. She said it didn't go with her stuff, so she gave it to me... she thought it fit in better with my "old time thingamajigs."

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Jesus, how can you stand her?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: God, she's going to kill me... this bottle is half-empty!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: That's great! "Half-empty" - that's what I like about you, Seymour, you're a natural pessimist!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: If you expect the worst, you're never disappointed.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What are you talking about? You're disappointed every minute of your life.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I'm just being realistic.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: At least you're not like every other stupid guy in the world - all they care about are guitars and sports... they're all such fags!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I hate sports.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: How come in all that time I was trying to get you a date, you never asked me out?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: You're a beautiful young girl... I can't imagine you would ever have had any interest in me, except as an amusingly cranky eccentric curiosity.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, but still... it's kind of insulting for a girl to be ignored like that.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I mean... of course I... why wouldn't I want to go out with you?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I dunno... I always feel like everybody secretly hates me. I'm just paranoid I guess. I mean, you like me don't you? We're good friends, right?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, sure. Of course.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: ...Maybe I should just move in here with you... I could do all the cooking and dust your record collection and stuff until I get a job.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What about Joe?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Oh yeah... and Dana...  You were a lot more fun before you met Dana. You've been acting way too normal lately... you're a bitter, twisted, fucked-up guy, Seymour, that's why I like you.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, well I like you too...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You know what my number one fantasy used to be?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I used to think about one day not telling anybody and just taking off and going to some random place... Do you ever think about stuff like that?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I guess I probably used to when I was your age.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: It would have to be some totally average day when nobody was expecting it, and I'd just disappear and they'd never see me again.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Sounds like a healthy way to deal with your problems.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: You know what we should do? Let's go get in your car right now and just take off! We could just drive away and find some new place and start a whole new life... fuck everybody!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I don't think I'm in any condition to drive.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'll drive, then -- we'll go out in a blaze of glory!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: So where would we go?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Who cares? Let's just go... what's stopping us?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I dunno, I...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I'm serious! I'm just so sick of everybody! Why can't I just do whatever I want?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What's the matter with you, Seymour? Don't you like me? Be a man for once in your life!

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: God, Dana's going to kill you!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: ...Do you really want us to drive away somewhere?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: What?... Maybe... no... I dunno...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I will if you want to.

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: No... forget it...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I-I never expected anything like this to happen...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Yeah, well... me neither...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: You must know I always... did you really mean all that about moving in with me?

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I was just thinking out loud...  I mean, you've got this whole thing with Dana -- I'm not going to let you fuck that up...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: But, I...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: Shhh... I really need to get some sleep.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I really want to talk to you. I've been thinking about what you said about moving in here...

turns.speaker: ENID
turns.text: I can treat him any way I want to - I'm an adult! Leave me alone!

turns.speaker: GERROLD
turns.text: So what's the story with the two cheerleaders over here?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: They're Seymour's.

turns.speaker: GERROLD
turns.text: Seymour? You gotta be kidding me!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't worry about it. He's not gettin' any and neither are you.

turns.speaker: GERROLD
turns.text: Let me tell ya somethin', Joe... Listen to me, Joe... you can't hit a home run without swinging the bat!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, here's where the fun never stops!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, I'm really, really happy. Really having a good time.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Still torturing yourself over that Enid, huh?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Where else am I ever going to find another girl who likes Geeshie Wiley records?  She could at least have the decency to call me back.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Maybe she was just using you to try and get back at some guy. Who knows? It could be a million things. It's wasted time trying to logically figure out the female brain, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Maybe she's got another boyfriend.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yeah, well... thanks for cheering me up.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No problem.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Please Josh?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Forget it, there's no way... find some other poor sucker to abuse.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: So Josh, if this guy freaks out, will you protect us?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: He has every reason to freak out -- this is a totally fucked-up thing to do to somebody!

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: I agree.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I wish I could see him.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Did you remember to pay the phone bill?

turns.speaker: JOSH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Call me sometime.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: I think that Phillip and Enid can help us to see that there are-many different ways we can express ourselves.  We can do things like these cartoons that are amusing as a sort of light entertainment or we can do work that is more serious in scope and feeling and that deals with issues; emotional, spiritual, political; of great importance. I hope that you will each have the tools to do that type of work by the end of this class.  Who is responsible for this?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Talk to us about it...

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: It's my response to the issue of a woman's right to choose... it's something I feel super-strongly about.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Isn't this a wonderful piece, class? This definitely falls into that higher category of art I was speaking of earlier.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: What do we have here, Margaret?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: It's a tampon in a teacup...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: I can see that... now what can you tell us about it? First of all, what kind of sculpture is this?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: It's a "found object"... that's when an artist takes an ordinary object and places it in an artistic context and thus it becomes art.

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: Very good. Now, what can you tell us about it in regard to your artistic intent?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: I guess I see the teacup as a symbol for womanhood, because of tea parties in the olden days, but instead of tea I was trying to kind of confront people with this... like...

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: This shocking image of repressed femininity!

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Right, exactly!

turns.speaker: ROBERTA
turns.text: I think it's really a wonderful piece, Margaret!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh... hi. Uh... Enid's stepmother told me I'd find her here?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: She's not at home?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: No... they said she was here...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What the fuck is she doing?! She was supposed to be here three hours ago!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Uh, do you mind if I wait? I really need to talk to her.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Are you sure she wasn't there?  Maybe she was just hiding from you.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Why would she be hiding from me?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: I don't know... where is she, then?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Maybe she's with Josh?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Josh!? Why would she be with Josh?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Why? What did she tell you?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: She just mentioned him a few times and said that they had been dating - I thought maybe she was...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: What? Is she having some secret affair with Josh?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I have no idea - I just want to...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Why wouldn't she tell me? There's no way! She could never keep that to herself... you're crazy.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Really, I don't know enough about it to...

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: That slut!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Why did you say she might be hiding from me? Did she say anything to you about me?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Yeah, she thinks you're a dork.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Did she say that?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Look, what do you expect?  Considering how we met you.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: On that pathetic fake blind date.

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: REBECCA
turns.text: Didn't she ever tell you about that? God, she really is pathological...

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: What fake blind date? What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: I have to admit, things have really started looking up for me since my life turned to shit.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: So tell me more about this job. What exactly will you be doing?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Well, mostly archival research, cataloguing old records and writing liner notes for their CD reissues. It's really... I can't believe it.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: Remember what I said when we first started -- this little breakdown might turn out to be the best thing that ever happened to you!

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: It doesn't pay very much, but I should be able to afford my own place in a few months... Do you think that's too soon? I'm really anxious to get my record collection out of storage...

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: Why don't we start with that next week?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Thank you, doctor.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: Don't thank me. You're doing all the work.

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: Seymour?

turns.speaker: SEYMOUR
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: THERAPIST
turns.text: Do you have a check for me?

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: You were contracted to work-

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: -malaria epidemic; very sudden.

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: Let me see the sick.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: Oh, you're a doctor now, too?

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: There is no reason for fear.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: On that I choose to remain dubious.  Two are dead now in two nights.

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: -oh, sing a different song, Abdullah-  -there's nothing wrong with your men so stop telling me there is-

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: -you do not call me a liar- you know nothing of their health- consider yourself fortunate I persuaded so many to stay- consider yourself fortunate I have decided to stay-

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: You think you matter?  -Beaumont is on that train- he matters-

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: He sees this chaos, he'll replace you all.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: He'll replace you, too- that's all you really care about.

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: You think so? Fine.  It's best you get out. Go. Tell all your people to go, run home where they'll be safe under the covers and when the bridge is built and the railroad is done, they can tell their women that out of all the thousands who worked here, they were the only ones to flee-

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: Morning, friend, glorious day.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: As are they all.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: The next time will be as this time- The Devil has come to Tsavo-

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: -that's ridiculous talk and you can't seriously believe it-

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: -now you're telling me my beliefs?- I don't think so-

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: I wasn't and you know it and don't push it- just listen- we have a problem in Tsavo-

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: -at last you're right- we do- you are the problem in Tsavo-

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: -careful, Abdullah-

turns.speaker: REDBEARD
turns.text: No hints, Samuel.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: You don't know all that has happened here- the Devil has come to Tsavo.

turns.speaker: REDBEARD
turns.text: You're right. The Devil has come. Look at me. I am the Devil.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: I am a man of peace.

turns.speaker: REDBEARD
turns.text: Am I to take it you want to live?

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: Most certainly. Absolutely. Yes.

turns.speaker: REDBEARD
turns.text: Excellent decision.  Your name is Abdullah? I'm sure we'll meet again. Go and enjoy the splendid morning.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: I think it's been a pleasure.

turns.speaker: REDBEARD
turns.text: Starting now, we attack them.

turns.speaker: ABDULLAH
turns.text: How; we don't know where they are?

turns.speaker: REDBEARD
turns.text: We'll have to make them come to us, won't we? And since there are two of them, we're going to set two plans in motion.  First: we must move the entire hospital by tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: BEAUMONT
turns.text: John Henry Patterson, come in. I'm Robert Beaumont.  Firm- I like that, tells me a lot about you-  -now why don't you tell me about me? To get you started, many people find me handsome, with a wonderful smile. I'm sure you agree.  Winning personality, heaps of charm?

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: My wife is the game player in the family, sir.

turns.speaker: BEAUMONT
turns.text: Games?  Look at me closely, Patterson: I am a monster. My only pleasure is tormenting people who work for me, such as yourself.  One mistake and I promise you this: I'll make you hate me.

turns.speaker: BEAUMONT
turns.text: -build the bridge over the Tsavo river. And be finished in four months time. Can you do that?

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: I'm sure you've examined my record. So you know I've never yet been late on a bridge.

turns.speaker: BEAUMONT
turns.text: You've never built in Africa.

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: But I have in India- every country presents problems.

turns.speaker: BEAUMONT
turns.text: You'll need your confidence, I promise you.

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: I've got a reason far beyond confidence: my wife is having our firstborn in five months and I promised I'd be with her when the baby comes.

turns.speaker: BEAUMONT
turns.text: Very moving, Patterson; I'm touched you confided in me.  But I don't really give a shit about your upcoming litter. I've made you with this assignment-  -don't make me break you.

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: You won't have the chance.  Any further words of encouragement?  Then I've a train to catch.

turns.speaker: PATTERSON
turns.text: Pleasant journey?

turns.speaker: BEAUMONT
turns.text: How could it be? I hate Africa.
